questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Match List - I with List - II :



  
    
    List - I 
Test/Reagents/Observation(s)
    
    List - II 
Species detected
  


  
    (a)
    Lassaigne's Test
    (i)
    Carbon
  
  
    (b)
    Cu(II) oxide
    (ii)
    Sulphur
  
  
    (c)
    Silver nitrate
    (iii)
    N, S, P, and halogen
  
  
    (d)
    The sodium fusion extract
 gives black precipitate with
 acetic acid and lead acetate
    (iv)
    Halogen Specifically
  



The correct match is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The structure of X is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: An unsaturated hydrocarbon X on ozonolysis gives A. Compound A when warmed with ammonical silver nitrate forms a bright silver mirror along the sides of the test tube. The unsaturated hydrocarbon X is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The exact volumes of 1 M NaOH solution required to neutralise 50 mL of 1 M H3PO3 solution and 100 mL of 2 M H3PO2 solution, respectively, are :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The characteristics of elements X, Y and Z with atomic numbers, respectively, 33, 53 and 83 are :

option_texts.A: X and Y are metalloids and Z is a metal.
option_texts.B: X and Z are non-metals and Y is a metalloid.
option_texts.C: X is a metalloid, Y is a non-metal and Z is a metal.
option_texts.D: X, Y and Z are metals.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which of the following is least basic?

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Ammonolysis of Alkyl halides followed by the treatment with NaOH solution can be used to prepare primary, secondary and tertiary amines. The purpose of NaOH in the reaction is :

option_texts.C: to activate NH_{3} used in the reaction
option_texts.D: to increase the reactivity of alkyl halide

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The secondary structure of protein is stabilised by:

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Fex2 and Fey3 are known when x and y are :

option_texts.A: x = F, Cl, Br, I and y = F, Cl, Br, I
option_texts.B: x = F, Cl, Br and y = F, Cl, Br, I
option_texts.C: x = F, Cl, Br, I and y = F, Cl, Br
option_texts.D: x = Cl, Br, I and y = F, Cl, Br, I

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Identify the elements X and Y using the ionisation energy values given below :



  
    
    Ionization energy (kJ/mol)
    
  


  
    
    1$${st}$$
    2$${nd}$$
  
  
    X
    495
    4563
  
  
    Y
    731
    1450

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: In the above reaction, the reagent ''A'' is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Arrange the following metal complex/compounds in the increasing order of spin only magnetic moment. Presume all the three, high spin system.

(Atomic numbers Ce = 58, Gd = 64 and Eu = 63)

(a) (NH4)2[Ce(NO3)6]

(b) Gd(NO3)3 and 

(c) Eu(NO3)3

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Identify the reagent(s) 'A' and condition(s) for the reaction

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Statement I : Sodium hydride can be used as an oxidising agent.

Statement II : The lone pair of electrons on nitrogen in pyridine makes it basic.

Choose the CORRECT answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: Statement I is false but statement II is true
option_texts.B: Both statement I and statement II are true
option_texts.C: Statement I is true but statement II is false
option_texts.D: Both statement I and statement II are false

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: [Ti(H2O)6]3+ absorbs light of wavelength 498 nm during a d $$-$$ d transition. The octahedral splitting energy for the above complex is ____________ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$19 J. (Round off to the Nearest Integer). h = 6.626 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$34 Js; c = 3 $$\times$$ 108 ms$$-$$1

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: A 5.0 m mol dm$$-$$3 aqueous solution of KCl has a conductance of 0.55 mS when measured in a cell of cell constant 1.3 cm$$-$$1. The molar conductivity of this solution is ___________ mSm2 mol$$-$$1. (Round off to the Nearest Integer).

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
At 25$$^\circ$$C, 50 g of iron reacts with HCl to form FeCl2. The evolved hydrogen gas expands against a constant pressure of 1 bar. The work done by the gas during this expansion is _________ J. (Round off to the Nearest Integer).

[Given : R = 8.314 J mol$$-$$1 K$$-$$1. Assume, hydrogen is an ideal gas] [Atomic mass of Fe is 55.85 u]

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The number of orbitals with n = 5, m1 = +2 is ___________. (Round off to the Nearest Integer).

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: A and B decompose via first order kinetics with half-lives 54.0 min and 18.0 min respectively. Starting from an equimolar non reactive mixture of A and B, the time taken for the concentration of A to become 16 times that of B is _________ min. (Round off to the Nearest Integer).

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: In Duma's method of estimation of nitrogen, 0.1840 g of an organic compound gave 30 mL of nitrogen collected at 287 K and 758 mm of Hg pressure. The percentage composition of nitrogen in the compound is __________. (Round off to the Nearest Integer). [Given : Aqueous tension at 287 K = 14 mm of Hg]

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: When 35 mL of 0.15 M lead nitrate solution is mixed with 20 mL of 0.12 M chromic sulphate solution, _________ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$5 moles of lead sulphate precipitate out. (Round off to the Nearest Integer).

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Sulphurous acid (H2SO3) has Ka1 = 1.7 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2 and Ka2 = 6.4 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$8. The pH of 0.588 M H2SO3 is __________. (Round off to the Nearest Integer).

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: At 363 K, the vapour pressure of A is 21 kPa and that of B is 18 kPa. One mole of A and 2 moles of B are mixed. Assuming that this solution is ideal, the vapour pressure of the mixture is ___________ kPa. (Round off to the Nearest Integer).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
If y = y(x) is the solution of the differential equation 

$${{dy} \over {dx}}$$ + (tan x) y = sin x, $$0 \le x \le {\pi  \over 3}$$, with y(0) = 0, then $$y\left( {{\pi  \over 4}} \right)$$ equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let f be a real valued function, defined on R $$-$$ {$$-$$1, 1} and given by 

f(x) = 3 loge $$\left| {{{x - 1} \over {x + 1}}} \right| - {2 \over {x - 1}}$$.

Then in which of the following intervals, function f(x) is increasing?

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let $$\overrightarrow a $$ = $$\widehat i$$ + 2$$\widehat j$$ $$-$$ 3$$\widehat k$$ and $$\overrightarrow b  = 2\widehat i$$ $$-$$ 3$$\widehat j$$ + 5$$\widehat k$$. If $$\overrightarrow r $$ $$\times$$ $$\overrightarrow a $$ = $$\overrightarrow b $$ $$\times$$ $$\overrightarrow r $$, 

$$\overrightarrow r $$ . $$\left( {\alpha \widehat i + 2\widehat j + \widehat k} \right)$$ = 3 and $$\overrightarrow r \,.\,\left( {2\widehat i + 5\widehat j - \alpha \widehat k} \right)$$ = $$-$$1, $$\alpha$$ $$\in$$ R, then the 

value of $$\alpha$$ + $${\left| {\overrightarrow r } \right|^2}$$ is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: If the foot of the perpendicular from point (4, 3, 8) on the line $${L_1}:{{x - a} \over l} = {{y - 2} \over 3} = {{z - b} \over 4}$$, l $$\ne$$ 0 is (3, 5, 7), then the shortest distance between the line L1 and line $${L_2}:{{x - 2} \over 3} = {{y - 4} \over 4} = {{z - 5} \over 5}$$ is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Consider a rectangle ABCD having 5, 7, 6, 9 points in the interior of the line segments AB, CD, BC, DA respectively. Let $$\alpha$$ be the number of triangles having these points from different sides as vertices and $$\beta$$ be the number of quadrilaterals having these points from different sides as vertices. Then ($$\beta$$ $$-$$ $$\alpha$$) is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let f : S $$ \to $$ S where S = (0, $$\infty $$) be a twice differentiable function such that f(x + 1) = xf(x). If g : S $$ \to $$ R be defined as g(x) = loge f(x), then the value of |g''(5) $$-$$ g''(1)| is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Consider the integral 
$$I = \int_0^{10} {{{[x]{e^{[x]}}} \over {{e^{x - 1}}}}dx} $$, 
where [x] denotes the greatest integer less than or equal to x. Then the value of I is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let C1 be the curve obtained by the solution of differential equation 

$$2xy{{dy} \over {dx}} = {y^2} - {x^2},x > 0$$. Let the curve C2 be the 

solution of $${{2xy} \over {{x^2} - {y^2}}} = {{dy} \over {dx}}$$. If both the curves pass through (1, 1), then the area enclosed by the curves C1 and C2 is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let P(x) = x2 + bx + c be a quadratic polynomial with real coefficients such that $$\int_0^1 {P(x)dx} $$ = 1 and P(x) leaves remainder 5 when it is divided by (x $$-$$ 2). Then the value of 9(b + c) is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let A = {2, 3, 4, 5, ....., 30} and '$$ \simeq $$' be an equivalence relation on A $$\times$$ A, defined by (a, b) $$ \simeq $$ (c, d), if and only if ad = bc. Then the number of ordered pairs which satisfy this equivalence relation with ordered pair (4, 3) is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The least value of |z| where z is complex number which satisfies the inequality $$\exp \left( {{{(|z| + 3)(|z| - 1)} \over {||z| + 1|}}{{\log }_e}2} \right) \ge {\log _{\sqrt 2 }}|5\sqrt 7  + 9i|,i = \sqrt { - 1} $$, is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Given that the inverse trigonometric functions take principal values only. Then, the number of real values of x which satisfy 

$${\sin ^{ - 1}}\left( {{{3x} \over 5}} \right) + {\sin ^{ - 1}}\left( {{{4x} \over 5}} \right) = {\sin ^{ - 1}}x$$ is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let the lengths of intercepts on x-axis and y-axis made by the circle 
x2 + y2 + ax + 2ay + c = 0, (a < 0) be 2$${\sqrt 2 }$$ and 2$${\sqrt 5 }$$, respectively. Then the shortest distance from origin to a tangent to this circle which is perpendicular to the line x + 2y = 0, is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let A($$-$$1, 1), B(3, 4) and C(2, 0) be given three points. 
A line y = mx, m > 0, intersects lines AC and BC at point P and Q respectively. Let A1 and A2 be the areas of $$\Delta$$ABC and $$\Delta$$PQC respectively, such that A1 = 3A2, then the value of m is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let A denote the event that a 6-digit integer formed by 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 without repetitions, be divisible by 3. Then probability of event A is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $${1 \over {16}}$$, a and b be in G.P. and $${1 \over a}$$, $${1 \over b}$$, 6 be in A.P., where a, b > 0. Then 72(a + b) is equal to ___________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
For real numbers $$\alpha$$, $$\beta$$, $$\gamma$$ and $$\delta $$, if 
$$\int {{{({x^2} - 1) + {{\tan }^{ - 1}}\left( {{{{x^2} + 1} \over x}} \right)} \over {({x^4} + 3{x^2} + 1){{\tan }^{ - 1}}\left( {{{{x^2} + 1} \over x}} \right)}}dx} $$

 $$ = \alpha {\log _e}\left( {{{\tan }^{ - 1}}\left( {{{{x^2} + 1} \over x}} \right)} \right) + \beta {\tan ^{ - 1}}\left( {{{\gamma ({x^2} + 1)} \over x}} \right) + \delta {\tan ^{ - 1}}\left( {{{{x^2} + 1} \over x}} \right) + C$$ 

where C is an arbitrary constant, then the value of 10($$\alpha$$ + $$\beta$$$$\gamma$$ + $$\delta$$) is equal to ______________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Consider the statistics of two sets of observations as follows :



  
    
    Size
    Mean
    Variance
  


  
    Observation I
    10
    2
    2
  
  
    Observation II
    n
    3
    1
  



If the variance of the combined set of these two observations is $${{17} \over 9}$$, then the value of n is equal to ___________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
Physics
questions.question_text: What will be the nature of flow of water from a circular tap, when its flow rate increased from 0.18 L/min to 0.48 L/min? The radius of the tap and viscosity of water are 0.5 cm and 10$$-$$3 Pa s, respectively. (Density of water : 103 kg/m3)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The refractive index of a converging lens is 1.4. What will be the focal length of this lens if it is placed in a medium of same refractive index? Assume the radii of curvature of the faces of lens are R1 and R2 respectively.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The following logic gate is equivalent to :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Statement I : A cyclist is moving on an unbanked road with a speed of 7 kmh$$-$$1 and takes a sharp circular turn along a path of radius of 2m without reducing the speed. The static friction coefficient is 0.2. The cyclist will not slip and pass the curve. (g = 9.8 m/s2)

Statement II : If the road is banked at an angle of 45$$^\circ$$, cyclist can cross the curve of 2m radius with the speed of 18.5 kmh$$-$$1 without slipping.

In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below.

option_texts.A: Statement I is incorrect and statement II is correct
option_texts.B: Both statement I and statement II are true
option_texts.C: Statement I is correct and statement II is incorrect
option_texts.D: Both statement I and statement II are false

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
A large block of wood of mass M = 5.99 kg is hanging from two long massless cords. A bullet of mass m = 10 g is fired into the block and gets embedded in it. The (block + bullet) then swing upwards, their centre of mass rising a vertical distance h = 9.8 cm before the (block + bullet) pendulum comes momentarily to rest at the end of its arc. The speed of the bullet just before collision is :
 (take g = 9.8 ms-2)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A mosquito is moving with a velocity $$\overrightarrow v  = 0.5{t^2}\widehat i + 3t\widehat j + 9\widehat k$$ m/s and accelerating in uniform conditions. What will be the direction of mosquito after 2 s?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Red light differs from blue light as they have :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The de-Broglie wavelength associated with an electron and a proton were calculated by accelerating them through same potential of 100 V. What should nearly be the ratio of their wavelengths? (mp = 1.00727u me = 0.00055u)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Calculate the value of mean free path ($$\lambda$$) for oxygen molecules at temperature 27$$^\circ$$C and pressure 1.01 $$\times$$ 105 Pa. Assume the molecular diameter 0.3 nm and the gas is ideal. (k = 1.38 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$23 JK$$-$$1)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A charge Q is moving $$\overrightarrow {dl} $$ distance in the magnetic field $$\overrightarrow {B} $$. Find the value of work done by $$\overrightarrow {B} $$.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In order to determine the Young's Modulus of a wire of radius 0.2 cm (measured using a scale of least count = 0.001 cm) and length 1m (measured using a scale of least count = 1 mm), a weight of mass 1 kg (measured using a scale of least count = 1 g) was hanged to get the elongation of 0.5 cm (measured using a scale of least count 0.001 cm). What will be the fractional error in the value of Young's Modulus determined by this experiment?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A resistor develops 500 J of thermal energy in 20 s when a current of 1.5A is passed through it. If the current is increased from 1.5A to 3A, what will be the energy developed in 20 s.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Find out the surface charge density at the intersection of point x = 3 m plane and x-axis, in the region of uniform line charge of 8 nC/m lying along the z-axis in free space.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The magnetic field in a region is given by $$\overrightarrow B  = {B_o}\left( {{x \over a}} \right)\widehat k$$. A square loop of side d is placed with its edges along the x and y axes. The loop is moved with a constant velocity $$\overrightarrow v $$ = v0$$\widehat i$$. The emf induced in the loop is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A bimetallic strip consists of metals A and B. It is mounted rigidly as shown. The metal A has higher coefficient of expansion compared to that of metal B. When the bimetallic strip is placed in a cold bath, it will :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: For the given circuit, comment on the type of transformer used.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A solid disc of radius 'a' and mass 'm' rolls down without slipping on an inclined plane making an angle $$\theta$$ with the horizontal. The acceleration of the disc will be $${2 \over b}$$g sin$$\theta$$ where b is ____________. (Round off to the Nearest Integer) (g = acceleration due to gravity, $$\theta$$ = angle as shown in figure)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The energy dissipated by a resistor is 10 mJ in 1 s when an electric current of 2 mA flows through it. The resistance is ___________$$\Omega$$. (Round off to the Nearest Integer)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In a parallel plate capacitor set up, the plate area of capacitor is 2 m2 and the plates are separated by 1 m. If the space between the plates are filled with a dielectric material of thickness 0.5 m and area 2 m2 (see fig.) the capacitance of the set-up will be __________$$\varepsilon $$o. (Dielectric constant of the material = 3.2) (Round off to the Nearest Integer)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
If one wants to remove all the mass of the earth to infinity in order to break it up completely.

The amount of energy that needs to be supplied will be $${x \over 5}{{G{M^2}} \over R}$$ where x is __________ (Round off to the Nearest Integer) (M is the mass of earth, R is the radius of earth, G is the gravitational constant)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A body of mass 2 kg moves under a force of $$\left( {2\widehat i + 3\widehat j + 5\widehat k} \right)$$N. It starts from rest and was at the origin initially. After 4s, its new coordinates are (8, b, 20). The value of b is _____________. (Round off to the Nearest Integer)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A closed organ pipe of length L and an open organ pipe contain gases of densities $$\rho$$1 and $$\rho$$2 respectively. The compressibility of gases are equal in both the pipes. Both the pipes are vibrating in their first overtone with same frequency. The length of the open pipe is $${x \over 3}L\sqrt {{{{\rho _1}} \over {{\rho _2}}}} $$ where x is ___________. (Round off to the Nearest Integer)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A swimmer can swim with velocity of 12 km/h in still water. Water flowing in a river has velocity 6 km/h. The direction with respect to the direction of flow of river water he should swim in order to reach the point on the other bank just opposite to his starting point is ____________$$^\circ$$. (Round off to the Nearest Integer) (Find the angle in degrees)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A deviation of 2$$^\circ$$ is produced in the yellow ray when prism of crown and flint glass are achromatically combined. Taking dispersive powers of crown and flint glass as 0.02 and 0.03 respectively and refractive index for yellow light for these glasses are 1.5 and 1.6 respectively. The refracting angles for crown glass prism will be ____________$$^\circ$$ (in degree). (Round off to the Nearest Integer)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A force $$\overrightarrow F $$ = $${4\widehat i + 3\widehat j + 4\widehat k}$$ is applied on an intersection point of x = 2 plane and x-axis. The magnitude of torque of this force about a point (2, 3, 4) is ___________. (Round off to the Nearest Integer)
